omb7notice.context: This is the first word of the OMB notice.

omb7submission.message: Представление информации является добровольным. Вся представленная информация будет общедоступной.
omb7submission.context: These are the first two sentences of the OMB notice.

omb7text.message: Public reporting burden for this collection of information is estimated to average 3 minutes per response. This estimate includes the time for reviewing instructions, gathering, and entering data. An agency may not conduct or sponsor, and a person is not required to respond to, a collection of information unless it displays a currently valid OMB control number. Send comments regarding this burden estimate or any other aspect of this collection of information, including suggestions for reducing this burden, to:
omb7text.context: This is the main paragraph of the OMB notice.

omb7sub.message: Я ознакомлен и согласен с условиями соглашения
omb7sub.context: This is the label for the OMB notice agreement button.

pushNotificationsDisallowed.message: Вы заблокировали данный сайт от получения уведомлений. Вы должны разблокировать данное разрешение чтобы воспользоваться функцией.
pushNotificationsDisallowed.context: This text tells the user that they have prohibited the site from using push notifications and that they must re-enable this feature to subscribe.

helpFindTitle.context: This is the title of the help page section on how to find/search.

helpFindText.message: If you are in search of a missing person or animal, you may attempt to locate them by searching one of our disaster events. When you first arrive at NLM PEOPLE LOCATOR, you are presented with a list of available disaster events. Each event has a name, a descriptive image related to the event, and some text describing the situation. If you scroll down, you will see there are a few different events from which you may select. Choose the event which you believe the person or animal you are trying to locate would most likely be in. For example, if there was an event named Haiti Earthquake and the person you are seeking was last seen in Haiti, you would choose this event. You can select an event by tapping/clicking on the large green button under the image. This will take you directly to the search screen for this particular disaster event. A new search box will appear at the top after you have made your selection. Enter the name of the person you are attempting to locate in this search box and press Enter. The search results will update with the most relevant matches at the top. You may acquire more information about a result by tapping on the details link near the bottom of the record. This opens a detailed view in which you may view more detailed record information, add a comment of your own, or begin following a record to be notified about updates.
helpFindText.context: This is the help page article body describing in detail how to find/search for a person or animal.

helpReportTitle.message: Help Reporting a Person or Animal
helpReportTitle.context: This is the title of the help page section on how to report.

helpReportText.message: If you are unable to locate the person or animal you seek, then you may report this person or animal to our PEOPLE LOCATOR registry. Once you have navigated to a disaster event, you will see a pink floating action button on the bottom right of the screen. Tapping/clicking this button will launch you into a wizard that will guide you through the process of filing a report. Once completed, your report will be entered into our searchable registry and be publicly visible to others. If your report was not done anonymously, you will automatically start to follow your own report for updates as they come in. Others may comment on your record providing you with new information about the person or animal you reported. Updates will be sent to you via email or push notifications.
helpReportText.context: This is the help page article body describing in detail how to report a person or animal.

pageAboutTextAbout.message: This site is provided by the United States National Library of Medicine in Bethesda, Maryland. NLM is part of the National Institutes of Health, United States Department of Health and Human Services, and has in its mission the development and coordination of communication technology to improve the delivery of health services. This site is provided for the purpose of studying the utility of such tools in responding to disasters. The underlying technology was developed through the Lost Person Finder project, part of NLM's contribution to the Bethesda Hospitals' Emergency Preparedness Partnership. The partnership received initial federal funding for LPF and other NLM IT projects in 2008. The LPF project is currently supported by the Intramural Research Program of the NIH, through NLM's Lister Hill National Center for Biomedical Communications. Software development is headed by LHNCBC's Communication Engineering Branch, with additional content from LHNCBC's Computer Science Branch and the Disaster Information Management Research Center, part of NLM's Specialized Information Services.
pageAboutTextAbout.context: This is the first paragraph of verbiage on the About page describing the purpose of the PEOPLE LOCATOR.

pageAboutTextBrowser.message: You must have cookies and JavaScript enabled in your web browser. You must also have one of the two most recent versions of one of the following web browsers: Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Opera, Edge, or Internet Explorer.
pageAboutTextBrowser.context: This is the text on the About page describing web browsers support.

pageAboutHeaderBrowser.context: On the About page, section header title Browser Support.

pagePrivacyText1.message: Unless otherwise indicated, community-based data contained on this Web site are available to the public and are searchable by all visitors to the Web site. Data may be received from various sources, as indicated on individual records by direct reporting to NLM through :

pagePrivacyText2a.context: Beginning of the second paragraph on the Privacy page.

pagePrivacyText2b.message: site are not moderated and other contributing organizations should not be expected to review or verify the accuracy of any of the data presented on this Web site. Note that data received by direct submission to

pagePrivacyText2c.message: may be disseminated to other agencies, institutions, and organizations assisting the effort to locate missing people, including but not limited to the
pagePrivacyText2c.context: End portion of the second paragraph of the Privacy page.

moduleInvalid.context: If the user attempts to access a non-existant portion of the site (very unlikely) this toast notification will appear.

moduleAccess.message: You do not have permission to access this module.

copyTrue.context: After the user clicks on the copy to clipboard button, if successful, this toast notification will appear.

copyFalse.message: Failed to copy URL to clipboard.
copyFalse.context: After the user clicks on the copy to clipboard button, if unsuccessful, this toast notification will appear.

userConfirmActive.message: Your email address is now confirmed and your user account activated.
userConfirmActive.context: When the user visits a confirmation link emailed to them, this toast notification will appear informing the user that their account is now active and email address verified.

userConfirmInvalid.context: When the user vists an invalid email address confirmation link or an invalid password reset confirmation link, this toast notification will appear.

userPasswordTwo.message: A new password has been emailed to you.
userPasswordTwo.context: When the user visits a valid password reset confirmation link, this toast notification will appear to notify the user a new password has been generated and emailed to them.

eurl1.context: This section text is displayed on the paper action dialog when a user clicks the share event button.

eurl2.context: This text appears under the button to share an event via email.

eurl3.context: This text appears under the button to share an event via clipboard.

eurl4.context: This button text label appears on the button for a user to share an event or record.

eurl5.context: This section text is displayed on the paper action dialog when a user clicks the share record button.

page404.context: This toast is displayed when a user attempts to visit a non-existant page.

ombNoticeTitle.context: This is the page title for the OMB Notice.

abuseReportAbuse.context: This is used as a sectional header and the label of the report abuse button.

abuseWhatReport.message: What would you like to report?
abuseWhatReport.context: This is the query presented to a user when asked to be more specific about the type of abuse report the user is filing.

abuseReportSpam.context: This is the button label to select a report abuse claim of type spam.

abuseReportSex.context: This is the button label to select a report abuse claim of type sexually explicit.

abuseReportHate.context: This is the button label to select a report abuse claim of type hate speech.

abuseReportViolence.context: This is the button label to select a report abuse claim of type violence

abuseReportElse.context: This button label is to select a report abuse claim of type something else.

abuseThanks.message: Thanks. We have received your abuse claim. Our site staff will review this record and remove any inappropriate content.

deleteRecord.context: This is used as a button label and dialog header allowing a user to delete a record from the system.

deleteRecordConfirm.message: Are you sure you want to delete this record? There is no way to recover your record data once it has been deleted.
deleteRecordConfirm.context: This is the question prompting a user when they choose to delete a record. We confirm they are certain with their decision.

deleteRecordCancel.context: Button label to cancel the action of deleting a record.

deleteRecordDelete.context: Button label to confirm the deletion of a record.

deleteRecordDone.context: A toast notification displayed to inform the user the deletion of a record action has been completed.

seconds.context: This word means seconds of time.

record.context: When a search is performed this word is prefixed with the number of results, ie. 1 record -- special case when only 1 result

notifyLogout.context: This notification will appear after the user successfully logs out.

uploadingPhoto.context: This message is displayed after a user selects an image file to search by photo as the file is being uploaded.

searchByPhoto.context: When a user elects to search by photo from the search query bar, a dialog box appears with this as the title.

dragAndDrop.context: A user may drag and drop a file to search by image. This message shows the user where to drag and drop the file ~ the target.

emailRecordRevisionSubject.message: A record you are following has been updated
emailRecordRevisionSubject.context: We email users following a record when a revision is made or a comment is added, this is the subject of that email.

emailRecordRevisionLine1.message: A comment has been added or a revision made to a record you are following.
emailRecordRevisionLine1.context: We email users following a record when a revision is made or a comment is added, this is the first line of that email.

emailRecordRevisionLine2.message: You can review the record at this location:
emailRecordRevisionLine2.context: We email users following a record when a revision is made or a comment is added, this line prefixes the direct record url.

emailRecordRevisionLine3.message: If you want to unsubscribe from these email alerts, visit the link above and untoggle the Following button.
emailRecordRevisionLine3.context: We email users following a record when a revision is made or a comment is added, at the end we inform the user of how to unsubscribe to these emails.

emailNewUserSubject.context: We email new users after they register, this is the subject line of said email.

emailNewUserLine1.context: We email new users after they register, this is the first line of said email thanking them for registering.

emailNewUserLine2.message: You must visit the link below in order to complete the registration process:
emailNewUserLine2.context: We email new users after they register, this is the second line of said email providing them a link complete the registration process.

emailNewUserLine3.message: Failure to visit the link will result in your account being deleted after 30 days.
emailNewUserLine3.context: We email new users after they register, this is the last line of said email warning the user about account deletion for failure to activate their account.

emailForgot1Subject.context: We email a user when they initiate the forgot password sequence, this is the subject of that email.

emailForgot1Line1.message: Someone has initiated a password reset request for your account.
emailForgot1Line1.context: We email a user when they initiate the forgot password sequence, this is the first line of that email.

emailForgot1Line2.message: If you did not initiate this request, it is safe to ignore this email and your password will not be changed.
emailForgot1Line2.context: We email a user when they initiate the forgot password sequence, we inform the user it is safe to ignore this request if they did not initiate it.

emailForgot1Line3.message: However, if you did initiate this request and would prefer to reset your password, you must visit the following link:
emailForgot1Line3.context: We email a user when they initiate the forgot password sequence, this line prefixes a url the user must click on to continue in the forgot password sequence.

emailForgot1Line4.message: Once this link has been visited, a new password will be generated and sent to you in a second email.
emailForgot1Line4.context: We email a user when they initiate the forgot password sequence, final line of this email informing a new password will be generated.

emailForgot2Subject.context: This is the second email in the forgot password sequence, and this is the subject of that email.

emailForgot2Line1.context: This is the second email in the forgot password sequence, this line prefixes the new password we generated for the user.

emailForgot2Line2.message: You may optionally change your password after signing in:
emailForgot2Line2.context: This is the second email in the forgot password sequence, lastly, we inform the user that they may change their password after logging in.

welcomeTo.context: The first time a user comes to PL, we welcome them like: Welcome to PEOPLE LOCATOR. However PEOPLE LOCATOR is not translated in this welcome message.

chooseLanguage.context: We prompt the user to select a language at first visit.

additionalInformation.context: This is a label displayed several places titled Additional Information.

inEvent.context: This substring 'in event' will appear atop search results under the search bar after '27 record' but before the event name (0.123 seconds)

viewOriginalRecord.context: This link appears on record with a forieign origin. Tapping on the link will open the record from its original location.

ncmec1.message: We suggest you also send this report to the National Center for Missing and Exploited Children as well.
ncmec1.context: In the reporting wizard, this message will be displayed when a report is completed for a child.

ncmec2.message: You can find a link to NCMEC here.
ncmec2.context: In the reporting wizard, this message will be displayed when a report is completed for a child. This is the link text.

pageResourcesNcmec.message: National Center for Missing and Exploited Children

eventListMeta.message: Find and report missing people and animals in
eventListMeta.context: Find and report missing people and animals in any disaster using this website.

eventListMeta3.message: using this National Library of Medicine website.
eventListMeta3.context: Find missing people using this National Library of Medicine website.

searchTitle.message: Find missing people and animals in
searchTitle.context: Find missing people and animals in the Mexico Earthquake.

searchMeta.message: Search for missing people and animals in
searchMeta.context: Search for missing people and animals in the Mexico Earthquake.

searchMeta2.context: Search for missing people by name or by photo

searchMeta3.message: using the National Library of Medicine's
searchMeta3.context: Search for missing people using the National Library of Medicine's NLM PEOPLE LOCATOR.

reportTitle.context: Report people and animals in the Mexico Earthquake.

reportMeta.message: Report the status of people and animals in
reportMeta.context: Report the status of people and animals in the Mexico City Earthquake.

recordTitle.context: Reported person Juan Valdez in the Mexico City Earthquake.

recordTitle2.context: Reported person Juan Valdez in the Mexico City Earthquake.

recordMeta.content: Juan Valdez has been reported missing on our website.

aboutMeta.message: The National Library of Medicine, part of the National Institutes of Health, created this website
aboutMeta.content: The National Library of Medicine, part of the National Institutes of Health, created this website for the public.

aboutMeta2.message: for finding and reporting missing people and animals during disasters.
aboutMeta2.content: We created this website for finding and reporting missing people and animals during disasters.

resourceMeta.message: Additional National Library of Medicine resources for
resourceMeta.content: Additional National Library of Medicine resources for finding people.

followUsMeta.message: Receive disaster alerts on social media from the National Library of Medicine's
followUsMeta.content: Receive disaster alerts on social media from the National Library of Medicine's NLM PEOPLE LOCATOR.

privacyMeta.message: Privacy policies governing the use of the National Library of Medicine's
privacyMeta.content: Privacy policies governing the use of the National Library of Medicine's NLM PEOPLE LOCATOR.

goHomePage.context: Displayed tooltip when you hover your mouse over the home button.

searchUsingPhoto.context: Displayed tooltip when you hover your mouse over the visual search button.

searchUsingName.context: Displayed tooltip when you hover your mouse over the search magnifying glass.

selectEvent.context: Title for a menu of PL events.

answerYes.context: The affirmative, yes, as in an answer to a question.

answerNo.context: The negative, no, as in an answer to a question.

rDeviceShort.context: This text will appear as a header on the dialog box that appears when a user is prompted to register a new device for push notifications. See below.

rDeviceLong.message: Would you like to register this device to recieve push notifications?
rDeviceLong.context: This dialog will appear when a user logs into from a 2nd, 3rd, 4th... device as a prompt to also recieve push notifications on this additional device.

appUpdate1.message: A new version of this app is available.
appUpdate1.context: When a new version of PL is updated online, a returning user will be prompted to update the version he/she is using.

appUpdate2.context: This label appears on the button to update the version of PL to the newest available. See above.

noTranslationAvailable.message: This event description has not been translated to your language so it is being shown in English.
noTranslationAvailable.context: This label appears on the button to update the version of PL to the newest available. See above.

helpFindText2.message: By default, searches will always return up to 50 results. However, if you would like to have it return more results, you can append or prepend the keyword perPage:100 to a search query which will effectively set a different limit on the number of results that are returned. The number 100 can be changed to any integer value. You may also modify the URL to achieve this filter effect. Here are some examples:
helpFindText2.context: This paragraph describes advanced search filters.
